appendix.title: DocBook Documentation Generation
appendix.para: &cartoweb; documentation source are in DocBook format. You may download the docbook-1-6-15 archive from the &cartoweb; website.

sect1.title: Documentation Generation on UNIX-like system
sect1.para: Execute: ./configure --enable-install then: make install to install and configure DocBook
To generate XHTML documentation, create a symbolic link in the install directory pointing to the CartoWeb documentation sources ($wwwroot/cartoweb3/documentation/user_manual/source)
Execute: make xhtml to generate an xhtml version of the documentation. This will be generated in $docbookinstalldir/xhtml
Execute: make pdf to generate an pdf version of the documentation. This will be generated in $docbookinstalldir/pdf You need to have Java isntalled on your system in order to generate pdf.

sect1.title: Documentation Generation on Windows using Cygwin
sect1.para: The only known way at this time to generate xhml or pdf version of the documentation on Windows is by using Cygwin
You will need to install the following Cygwin packages: libxml2, libxslt, make.

Then follow the same instructions as for UNIX-like system
In docbook 1.69.0, the xhtml generation process produce a validity error at the end of the files creation. It should be fixed in 1.69.1
